dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Global stocks are surging after that new Saudi-Russia oil deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Global stocks are surging after that new Saudi-Russia oil deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, the Nikkei in Japan was up over 5% on Monday, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, the Nikkei in Japan was up over five percent on Monday, that's huge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Japans Nikkei index fell more than 5% on Monday, while stocks in Hong Kong and mainland China were also down as panicked investors in Asia flocked to safe-haven assets like government bonds and the Japanese yen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And it wasn't just Asia—Europe followed right along. The FTSE 100 in London jumped almost 8%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it wasn't just Asia-Europe followed right along. The F T S E one hundred in London jumped almost eight percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and France's CAC 40 was up more than 7%, Germany's DAX 6%. Just a massive rally across the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and France's C A C forty was up more than seven percent, Germany's D A X six percent. Just a massive rally across the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: European stocks followed suit, with Londons FTSE 100 index down almost 8% on Monday morning, Frances CAC 40 more than 7% and Germanys DAX 6%.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: U.S. futures were way up too, like S&P futures gaining over 5%. It's all tied to oil, with Brent crude hitting $63 a barrel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: U.S. futures were way up too, like S&P futures gaining over five percent. It's all tied to oil, with Brent crude hitting sixty three dollars a barrel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: U.S. futures were sharply down, with S&P 500 futures down more than 5%. Oil prices plummeted with the benchmark Brent crude down to $33.20 a barrel, while West Texas Intermediate fell 31%, to $28.32 a barrel on Sunday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is, uh, the smallest gain since the Gulf War in '91, but still a major spike.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, uh, the smallest gain since the Gulf War in 'ninety one, but still a major spike.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Global stocks plunged after crude oil posted its biggest fall since the 1991 Gulf War after Saudi Arabia launched a price war with Russia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Australia's markets added something like $90 billion in value on Monday alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Australia's markets added something like ninety dollars billion in value on Monday alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, that's their best performance since the financial crash. It feels like everyone's rushing out of bonds and into stocks again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, that's their best performance since the financial crash. It feels like everyone's rushing out of bonds and into stocks again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some $90 billion ($140 billion AUD) was wiped off Australias markets on Monday, with the benchmark ASX falling more than 7%its worst performance since the global financial crash.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But Goldman Sachs is warning that oil could hit $60 if coronavirus doesn't spread further and cooperation intensifies.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Goldman Sachs is warning that oil could hit sixty dollars if coronavirus doesn't spread further and cooperation intensifies.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Oil prices could drop to a low of $20 a barrel, Goldman Sachs analysts warned on Sunday, if the coronavirus continues to spread and the oil price war intensifies.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, which is a big if—new cases are still rising in the U.S., and the U.K. is now the largest cluster of deaths outside China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, which is a big if-new cases are still rising in the U.S., and the U.K. is now the largest cluster of deaths outside China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The number of new cases in China, where the pneumonia-like virus was detected, appear to be falling, while cases around the world continue to prompt strict quarantine measures, particularly in Italy, now the largest cluster of Covid-19-related deaths outside China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Still, investors seem relieved for now. Even after that Fed rate hike earlier this month shook things up briefly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, investors seem relieved for now. Even after that Fed rate hike earlier this month shook things up briefly.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Reserves emergency rate on March 3, 2020, provided a momentary confidence boost for the markets, which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: True, but everyone's gonna be watching what the G7 does next to keep this momentum going.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: True, but everyone's gonna be watching what the G7 does next to keep this momentum going.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Federal Reserves emergency rate on March 3, 2020, provided a momentary confidence boost for the markets, which now will look for coordinated action from the G7 club of advanced economies to underpin the global economy.

artist_script:
HostA: Global stocks are surging after that new Saudi-Russia oil deal.
HostB: Yeah, the Nikkei in Japan was up over 5% on Monday, that's huge.
HostA: And it wasn't just Asia—Europe followed right along. The FTSE 100 in London jumped almost 8%.
HostB: Right, and France's CAC 40 was up more than 7%, Germany's DAX 6%. Just a massive rally across the board.
HostA: U.S. futures were way up too, like S&P futures gaining over 5%. It's all tied to oil, with Brent crude hitting $63 a barrel.
HostB: Which is, uh, the smallest gain since the Gulf War in '91, but still a major spike.
HostA: Australia’s markets added something like $90 billion in value on Monday alone.
HostB: Wow, that's their best performance since the financial crash. It feels like everyone's rushing out of bonds and into stocks again.
HostA: But Goldman Sachs is warning that oil could hit $60 if coronavirus doesn't spread further and cooperation intensifies.
HostB: Yeah, which is a big if—new cases are still rising in the U.S., and the U.K. is now the largest cluster of deaths outside China.
HostA: Still, investors seem relieved for now. Even after that Fed rate hike earlier this month shook things up briefly.
HostB: True, but everyone's gonna be watching what the G7 does next to keep this momentum going.
